results.title: The interactions of CAP and LYN with the insulin signaling transducer CBL play an important role in polycystic ovary syndrome.
results.text_hl: In @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, Cap overexpression, Cap transactivation by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, or enhancing @GENE_CBL @GENE_12402 @@@Cbl@@@-@GENE_CRK @GENE_12928 @@@CrkII@@@ binding improved @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ sensitivity and @DISEASE_Ovarian_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D010049 @@@ovarian dysfunction@@@ (i.e., estrous cycle disruption, cyst-like follicle formation, and @<m>DISEASE_Sex_Chromosome_Disorders_of_Sex_Development</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058533 @@@sex hormone dysregulation@@@).
